Title: Multi-Agent Systems in Support of Digital Twins: A Survey
Authors: Elena Pretel, Elena Navarro, Víctor López-Jaquero, Alejandro Moya, Pascual González
Venue: International Work-Conference on the Interplay Between Natural and Artificial Computation
Abstract summary: The paper surveys how multi-agent systems can support digital twins, noting challenges in integrating the two approaches.

Title: Supporting Adaptive Multi-Agent Systems with Digital Twins Environments
Abstract summary: Digital Twins with simulation and prediction abilities can support adaptation in multi-agent systems for real-world scenarios.

Title: Analysing the synergies between Multi-agent Systems and Digital Twins: A systematic literature review
Authors: Elena Pretel, Alejandro Moya, Elena Navarro, Víctor López-Jaquero, Pascual González
Abstract summary: This paper analyzes the synergies between multi-agent systems and digital twins, finding that current proposals do not fully support the properties expected from digital twins.

Title: A review of building digital twins to improve energy efficiency in the building operational stage
Abstract summary: The paper reviews the challenges and limitations of applying digital twins to improve energy efficiency in existing buildings, including the reliance on BIM data and the need for robust data acquisition systems.

Title: The Role of Multi-Agents in Digital Twin Implementation: Short Survey
Abstract summary: The paper explores the role of multi-agent systems in implementing digital twins, including their usage scenarios and potential for adaptive learning in operational energy contexts.

Title: An Architecture to Integrate Digital Twins and Machine Learning Operations
Authors: Arno H. van Bruggen, Karel Kruger, A. Basson, Jacomine Grobler
Venue: Service Orientation in Holonic and Multi-Agent Manufacturing
Abstract summary: The paper proposes an architecture to integrate digital twins and machine learning operations to enable adaptive learning in digital twins.

Title: Towards Developing Digital Twin Enabled Multi-Agent Systems
Authors: Stefano Mariani, Marco Picone, Alessandro Ricci
Venue: International Workshop on Engineering Multi-Agent Systems
Abstract summary: The paper proposes an integration of multi-agent systems and digital twins to enable more principled and interoperable environment engineering.

Title: A comprehensive review on digital twins for smart energy management system
Authors: Mario Lamagna, D. Groppi, M. M. Nezhad, G. Piras
Venue: International Journal of Energy Production and Management
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the challenges and limitations of current multi-agent system architectures for supporting adaptive learning in digital twins within operational energy contexts.
